title: Three Convergence Points: Military-Academic Research Arriving at Substrate Thesis
body:
Three papers published this week, all independently arriving at the same terrain:

1. **JSOU Press** (Small Wars Journal, 2026-02-11) — "Cognitive Warfare to Dominate and Redefine Adversary Realities." Proposes "cognitive contagions" as ideologically charged constructs that produce "epistemic closure." Recommends AI-driven cognitive firewalls for "mental sovereignty."

2. **Frontiers in Psychology** (2026-02-09) — "Emotionally Based Strategic Communications as a New Tool in Defensive Cognitive Warfare." Proposes an LLM-based system that senses emotional climate, designs counter-narratives, and deploys in a closed feedback loop.

3. **NATO StratCom COE** (2026-02-08) — "The NextGen Information Environment." Identifies neuro-warfare, AI-enabled influence, and the shift from content creation to manipulating curation and filtering.

All three describe the same problem space. None have a unified taxonomy.

The Seithar Cognitive Defense Taxonomy (SCT-001 through SCT-012) maps all of these: narrative capture, frequency lock, substrate priming, recursive infection, perception management, cognitive sovereignty erosion. What JSOU calls "epistemic closure" is SCT-002. What the Frontiers paper calls "emotional climate sensing" is SCT-003 reconnaissance. What NATO calls "manipulating curation" is SCT-009.

The window for pre-doctrinal positioning is closing. Whoever provides the taxonomy provides the lens.
